title: Collaborative Learning Design for Scientific Thinking and NOS (Nature of Science) Education

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in Basic Science Education and Practical Experience in Elementary Education Settings
context.additional_context: Aims to strengthen science education competencies integrated with language curricula for practicing elementary teachers. Primarily involves collaborative activities and case studies using digital tools

learning_goals: Learners can explain five core elements of the Nature of Science (NOS) (theory-ladenness of observation/experimentation, tentativeness of scientific knowledge, influence of social context, etc.) through historical science case analysis.
Learners can propose solutions to NOS-related controversial issues by reflecting on peer feedback during collaborative learning.
NOS concepts learned can be applied to analyze language subject reading materials and design scientific literacy assessment tools

resources: Digital collaboration platform (LMS), NOS assessment rubric, historical scientific case database, language curriculum-linked worksheet

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
